title: PrinParLat

fields.name: form_id
fields.title: Form table row identifiers
fields.description: These identifiers are specific to form, lexeme, cell triples.

fields.name: lexeme
fields.title: Reference to a lexeme identifier
fields.description: Lexeme identifiers must be unique to paradigms.

fields.name: cell
fields.title: Reference to a cell identifier
fields.description: The set of feature values as would appear in a gloss, separated by dots, eg. prs.ind.1sg or f.pl

fields.name: orth_form
fields.title: Inflected form (orthographic)
fields.description: The form, given orthographically

fields.name: analysed_orth_form
fields.title: Inflected form with analysis, such as segmentation markers (orthographic)
fields.description: The form, given orthographically, with markers for analysis.

fields.name: flexeme
fields.title: Flexeme identifier
fields.description: Reference to identifier(s) of the flexeme(s) to which the forms can be assigned, colon separated.

fields.name: cell_id
fields.title: Cell identifier
fields.description: The set of feature values as would appear in a gloss, separated by dots, eg. prs.ind.1sg or f.pl

fields.name: unimorph
fields.title: Cell in unimorph format
fields.description: The cell, written following the unimorph schema

fields.name: value_id
fields.title: Grammatical Feature value identifier
fields.description: Identifier for the grammatical feature value (as found in the cell)

fields.name: label
fields.title: label for this row
fields.description: A human readable label for the row.

fields.name: feature
fields.title: feature
fields.description: The name of the dimension of this feature, eg. case, tense, modality, voice, force, gender, evidentiality, person, number, polarity...

fields.name: canonical_order
fields.title: Sorting order for visual presentation
fields.description: The order in which items are canonically presented. Use integers to represent relative order, order is used per-item.

fields.name: flexeme_id
fields.title: Flexeme identifier
fields.description: Identifier of the flexeme.

fields.name: inflection_class
fields.title: Inflection class identifier
fields.description: This identifier groups together lexemes of the same inflection class.

fields.name: lila_id_lemma
fields.title: lemma ID
fields.description: ID of the corresponding lemma in the LiLa Knowledge Base.

fields.name: hasInflectionType
fields.title: Inflection Type
fields.description: Code corresponding to the Inflection Type (i.e., traditional, coarse-grained inflection class) assigned to the lemma in the LiLa Knowledge Base.

fields.name: grapheme_id
fields.title: grapheme representation
fields.description: These identifiers are specific to graphemes.

fields.name: canonical_order
fields.title: Sorting order for visual presentation
fields.description: The order in which items are canonically presented. Use integers to represent relative order, order is used per-item.

fields.name: inflectionclasses-patterns_id
fields.title: ID
fields.description: Identifier for the row.

fields.name: inflection_class
fields.title: Inflection class identifier
fields.description: This identifier groups together lexemes of the same inflection class.

fields.name: pattern
fields.title: Pattern identifier
fields.description: Reference to the identifier of the alternation pattern.

fields.name: lexeme_id
fields.title: Identifier for the lexeme
fields.description: Lexeme identifiers. Often, they are identical to the label (lemma). However, they must be unique to paradigms, distinguishing homonyms with different inflection. For example, the animal mouse/mice and the computer peripheric mouse/mouses would both have the label 'mouse' but could be identified by the lexeme identifiers mouse_1 and mouse_2.

fields.name: label
fields.title: label for this row
fields.description: A human readable label for the row.

fields.name: pattern_id
fields.title: Pattern ID
fields.description: Identifier of the alternation pattern.

fields.name: pattern_alternation
fields.title: Alternation pattern
fields.description: Alternation pattern between two cells.

fields.name: cell_left
fields.title: Left cell
fields.description: Reference to the identifier of the cells on the left for the relevant alternation pattern.

fields.name: cell_right
fields.title: Right cell
fields.description: Reference to the identifier of the cells on the right for the relevant alternation pattern.

citation: Pellegrini, M. & Passarotti, M. & Mambrini, F. & Moretti, G. 2023. PrinParLat. Online resource.
